workflow.title: Algorithm C: follow-up of Persistent Symptoms

step.content: Reassess symptom severity and functional status and complete psychosocial evaluation.

step.title: Are Symptoms and Functional Status Improved?
Are any Behavioral Health Disorders Established?
step.content:
Assess for possible alternative causes for persistent symptoms:

  • Sleep disorder
  • Mood disorder
  • Depression
  • Traumatic stress
  • Anxiety
  • Substance use disorder

step.title: Initiate/Continue Symptomatic Treatment and Provide Patient and Family Education
Are any Persistent Physical, Cognitive or Emotional Symptoms Present?
Manage Comorbidity According to the Appropriate VA/DoD Clinical Practice Guidelines for Behavioral Health Conditions and Consider Referral to Mental Health.
Consider Referral to Occupational/Vocational Therapy and Community Integration Programs and Continue Case Management.
Refer for Further Specialty Evaluation and Treatment.
Encourage, Reinforce and Monitor for Comorbid Conditions.
Follow up and Reassess in Three to Four Months.
